item.title: The Toxicity Of Open Source
item.description: My most recent experiences though really saddened me and exposed a certain toxicity in the OSS community that I really wish wasn’t so prevalent. I’ve been posting on and off on dev.to but I never introduced myself so let me preface this post with a bit about me to give some context. I’ve been using open source and Linux on and off since the early 2000s. My first Linux distro was Caldera 2.

item.title: Docker IPV6 Guide
item.description: I spent a good bit of time trying to figure this out, so I thought I’d record this for posterity’s sake and others might benefit. Assumptions: You are somewhat familiar with docker You have some exposure with docker-compose You have at least a basic understanding of networking fundamentals. I’m not a networking expert but you should have an understanding of TCP, the existence of IPV4 and IPV6 and how they differ.

item.title: Converting Raid 1 to Raid 5 on Linux file systems
item.description: Converting from Raid 1 to Raid 5 This assumes you have a functional Raid 1 and wish to convert it to a Raid 5. Disclaimer: At some point during this process I realized that I had a bad mother board. The reason my /dev/sdd1 failed wasn’t the drive, but the bus on the board. That being said, this is the unverified procedure. I’m running on Ubuntu 12.10 but you should be able to do this on any modern Linux distribution.
